question: What part of the eye does AMD primarily affect? a) Cornea b) Lens c) Macula d) Optic nerve
Which type of AMD is more common? a) Dry AMD b) Wet AMD c) Both equally d) Neither
What is a primary symptom of AMD? a) Eye pain b) Blurred central vision c) Improved night vision d) Double vision
Which is a major risk factor for AMD? a) Drinking water b) Exercising daily c) Smoking d) Wearing glasses
What is the leading cause of vision loss in older adults? a) Cataracts b) Glaucoma c) AMD d) Diabetic retinopathy
Which treatment is used for wet AMD? a) Eye drops b) Anti-VEGF injections c) Vitamin C d) Laser eye surgery
What are drusen associated with? a) Dry AMD b) Wet AMD c) Glaucoma d) Cataracts
Which test can detect AMD symptoms? a) Blood test b) Hearing test c) Amsler grid d) X-ray
Who is most at risk for AMD? a) Children b) People over 50 c) Teenagers d) Athletes
What does wet AMD involve? a) Excessive blinking b) Lens clouding c) Abnormal blood vessel growth d) Cornea damage
Which nutrient may slow AMD progression? a) Vitamin A b) Sugar c) Sodium d) Caffeine
What is a common diagnostic tool for AMD? a) MRI b) Dilated eye exam c) ECG d) Ultrasound
What vision does AMD primarily affect? a) Peripheral b) Central c) Color d) Night
